text:
Made this tonight, it was delicious! I didn't have any breadcrumbs or crackers, so I used Stove Top stuffing..and OH MY GOD!! I used 2 small packs of ground beef with the full package of Stove Top stuffing, 2 eggs, 1 cup of milk, ground pepper and a dash of salt and 1 medium sized onion, I didn't grease my 8 mini loaf pan...the sauce was amazing, but as others stated, next time I will double maybe even triple the batch. 

I don't think I will try it with the peppers and mushrooms though, as it is suppose to be a meatloaf, not a veggie loaf but I did however make steamed veggies(broccoli, cauliflower and carrots) and a baked potato mashed with a bit of butter then topped with some chives, real bacon bits, cheese and sour cream.

Also the next time I cook this, I will maybe line my 8 mini loaf pan with a strip each of bacon before filling them with the ground beef mixture ...mmmmm bacon ;)

text:
This was delicious! As others mentioned, I sauteed the onions, added about 1 tbs Worcestershire sauce and about 1/2 tsp garlic powder to the meat mixture.  I also doubled the sauce, which would be a great idea regardless, but was especially helpful since I used 2 pounds of beef. Then formed it into a loaf, baked it for 1.25 hours and let it sit for about 5 minutes. Stayed together when sliced and tasted amazing! Family approved! Thank you for this wonderful recipe.

text:
I have made this recipe plenty of times (over 10) and everyone who I have made it for, loves it! I don't do the brown sugar on top, I just put ketchup in the mix and put it on the top and use no mustard. I also do put a little more breadcrumbs in it but not much more. I use the Italian flavor bread crumbs. Everything sticks together just fine and it is delicious! I also cover it with aluminum foil for the first 45 minutes and take it off for the last 15 minutes. Cooks perfectly! Definitely recommend to anyone!!

text:
It was so easy to make! I had 1.5 lbs of lean ground beef and when it cooked it shrunk and had to drain a lot of juices. Next time I'll use extra lean hopefully that will take care of the shrinking and excess juices. I covered it with foil for the first hour and cooked uncovered for the last 25 mins in a metal loaf pan. For the sauce, bf doesn't like mustard so I used chipotle BBQ sauce and I only used 1 TBS brown sugar. I also sautéed the onions and garlic before putting it in the mix and added Worcester sauce to the meat.

I made a 3lb meatloaf and changed up just a few things. My daughter does not like onion so, this time I used my emulsifier to really blend the onions up and I added diced garlic.  About 6 cloves.  I also used 2 cups of breadcrumbs but only 1.5 cups milk, the onion adds moister.  I mixed the milk and breadcrumbs together and let sit for a few mins while I added my salt and pepper.  It came out delish.  This is how I will be making it from now on.

text:
I made a few changes to this recipe....

I use 2 pounds or more of meat and keep the amounts the same. 


I added worcestershire and the topping into the meat. Instead of bread crumbs I use butter crackers and smoosh them up enough to make a cup (in a liquid measuring cup). I also add garlic salt, pepper, and salt. Then I add the sauce to the top as well and poke holes in it so the sauce can drain into the loaf.

Everyone I've made it for, loves it. And my husband hated meatloaf before I made this one.

reviewsCount:

photo:
https://images.media-allrecipes.com/userphotos/50x50/3271388.jpg
city:
None
region:
None
country:
None
text:
I love smokey bbq flavor, so in the ketchup/mustard/brown sugar sauce I added about 2 tablespoons of Johnny Trigg original BBQ sauce.

In the meatloaf mixture I added about 3 tablespoons of parm cheese, oregano and paprika.

To avoid a mess in my oven, I placed the loaf pan on top of a baking pan.

Thank you for reading!

text:
This was a great recipe.  I changed it a little by adding  chopped green pepper  and replaced the combination of mustard, ketchup & brown sugar to barbeque sauce.  I added about 1/2 cup of barbeque sauce to the meat mixture in addition to spreading it on top before baking.   When I make it next time, I will saute the onions & pepper before adding to meat mixture. I needed to bake the meatloaf an additional 30 min. to get the internal temperature where it needed to be.   It was very good and will use this recipe again.

city:

region:
None
country:
None
text:
Made this last night for myself and 6 houseguests. It was truly the best meatloaf I've ever had; super easy to throw together, everyone loved it. 
Here are my changes:
Add 2 1/2 tbsp. of Worcestershire sauce and a cup of shredded cheese to the ground beef. When you put it in the oven to bake, set the meatloaf pan in another pan (preferably a glass Pyrex) with a little water in the bottom to keep it moist while it cooks. After it cooks for the full hour, drain the oil from the pan as much as possible and broil for 2-3 minutes to get the sauce to stay firmly on top and add a little firmness to the loaf. Delicious!

text:
This was my first time making meatloaf. I expected a bit more flavor from this. I used Italian bread crumbs, added green pepper & Worcestershire. I followed the recipe as written other than those changes. I think it needs less breadcrumbs, more topping, and more of a meaty flavor. This baked on a foil lined baking sheet with a wire rack for grease drainage. It wasn't done after an hour of baking. It took about an hr and 45 min. The last 15 min, I jacked the temp to 400 to bake more of the topping on. My boyfriend said this was good & tasted like Mom's. I would make this again for him. Just ok for me.

Really good recipe!  Sauteed onions 1st, double topping.  Variations are endless.  I tried with pesto and tomato past on top-yum.  Used Dijon mustard another time, don't need ketchup on top if using tomato sauce in loaf.  Really takes only  1 hr for 1.2 lbs ground beef in 8x8x2 pan.  If you add >1 cup liquid or sauce to this, must increase breadcrumbs too, or will not set up.  1 cup stale seed crackers in it was so good!

Absolutely yummy and very easy to make.

LOVE this recipe. It is my "go to" meatloaf basic. We have this for dinner at least once every month it seems.
I add a finely diced green pepper, a splash of Worcester sauce, and either seasoned breadcrumbs or a large dash of Italian seasoning (or both when I'm feeling frisky.) Then to finish it off I just slather it in whatever BBQ sauce I have around. I love BBQ and meatloaf.

text:
An unusual meatloaf.  We liked the sauce but the meatloaf itself is a little bit bland.  I took other reviewers' advice and sautéed the onions with garlic and a sweet pepper in olive oil.  I used Italian bread crumbs.  It is very important to let the meatloaf rest for at least 20 minutes or so after you take it out of the oven.  It firms up and the flavor does improve.  I have a feeling it will be good on sandwiches tomorrow.  Thank you for the recipe.

text:
Easiest Meat Loaf ever! I am a novice, so this is perfect for me! We have a family of 3...2 adults and 1 toddler. My husband said it was the best meat loaf he has ever had! And my toddler at ALL of his helping! The only alterations I made was I actually added 1 helping of the ketchup,mustard, and brown sugar mix to my meat and mixed it into the loaf..then made another mix of it and put that one on top of the loaf. Turned out perfect! I also did not put a whole onion in, we used 1/2 of an onion and it was just enough. :) Highly recommend!

text:
This is a great recipe. My husband and even picky kids destroy this at dinner. There are usually no leftovers. The only things I altered were to brown the onions a bit before adding to the meat, and doubling the glaze. I reduced the mustard by about half. Also, Italian bread crumbs add more flavor than plain so I use those. Some have commented that the glaze is too sweet. It IS sweet, but I think the tangy sweet glaze is exactly why the kids and husband love it so. This has become my stand by meatloaf recipe. Easy, simple, delicious.

text:
Followed other reviewers changes:  Sauteed onions in butter and clove of garlic to soften.  Added 2 tbsp of ketchup and 1 tbsp of A1 (because I didn't have Worsc sauce) to the meat mix. I also used garlic breadcrumbs because I didn't have Italian (which was suggested by many).  And in the sauce recipe I reduced the mustard by 1/2 and added the difference in extra ketchup.  Baked about 15 min longer.  Was the best meatloaf we've ever had!  I think the sweet/tangy sauce really added to the dish.  Baked in perfectly!

I made this exactly as the recipe states.  Everyone in our house liked the meatloaf (including our 3 young children).  I really love the ketchup/mustard/brown sugar mix for the top, but I thought the actual meatloaf itself was a little bland.  I will try a little worcestershire sauce and saute the onion beforehand next time. text:
Delicious!!!  I left out 1/2 lb. of the beef because I only had 1 lb., and left out the brown sugar because I forgot.  I goofed up and put the mustard and ketchup into the beef mix, so I put additional ketchup and mustard on top.  I used evaporated milk, only 1/2 c because I didn't have any fresh milk.  I also added some Miami Spice meat loaf seasoning, about 1 Tbsp, 1 t freshly ground Celtic sea salt and 1/2 t freshly ground pepper.  It turned out super moist and tasty!

text:
I followed the recipe except I added dehydrated onion that I had on hand. Used 1 lb of ground beef extra lean.  I used less sugar and mustard for the topping since I was using one pound beef  Used a hamburger bun which had sesame onion and poppy seeds on the top for the bread portion.  Added a few shakes of Lowrys garlic salt. No other changes were made to the recipe. My husband said "This is the best loaf you've made. No need to buy those packet of meatloaf mix any more". I baked it on a cookie sheet using non stick foil for easy clean up. Baked in confection oven per recipe at 350 for on hour. This will make wonderful leftover sandwiches. Thr topping topped it off.

Yum! Just ate a serving of this fresh out of the oven. Nice crispy outside and spongy inside. Substitutions: ground turkey not ground beef, water not milk, rolled oats not bread crumbs, and I added 1/4 cup of "Italian mix" herbs. I doubled the recipe except for the brown sugar and I baked it at 375 F for 90 minutes. It filled a 9x13" pan with room to spare.

text:
My husband loved it, so the amount of brown sugar was fine with us...as he is quite opioniated if things are too sweet. 
I doubled the recipe using two lbs. ground beef & 1 lb. pork. I cut down on the milk to 1.5 cups, as I wax mixing the meat for fear it  would get too loose. Following other suggestions, I sautéed onions and chopped garlic cloves (also added chopped up mushrooms) in butter before adding to meat mixture. I forgot to add worcestershire to meat, so I added it to sauce (along with the leftover onions & mushrooms because I made too much of that)...amazing!!! Thank you for submitting the recipe!

None
region:
None
country:
None
text:
Very moist but you must follow the recipe additions from other reviews. Sauté the onions and double if not triple the ketchup mixture. I like the mustard taste so I will keep that ratio the same. If you are not a big fan of that taste, then reduce the mustard ratio. Worcehestier will help with the lack of seasoning in the mix along with seasoned breadcrumbs. I would also recommend making it on a baking sheet as a loaf instead of in a loaf pan like I did. The ketchup mixture is delicious but only stays on the top in a loaf pan, baking in a sheet will allow the mixture to cover the top and sides, making it delicious!
Review:
Rating:
4
dateLastModified:
2015-07-02T14:00:23.457

text:
I've been married for 12 years now and have never made meatloaf before.  Actually, I don't even remember having it very often when I grew up.  Can't even remember why I decided I was going to try it.  This recipe looked really easy and yet had great reviews so figured I'd give it a try.  Wow.  Love the flavor.  I did add the changes that almost everyone says: used Italian breadcrumbs,  1 TBS worcestershire sauce and a bit of garlic powder for flavor (we don't do onions in this house so too lazy to chop some garlic and saute them on their own).  I doubled the ketchup and brown sugar but left the mustard to 2 TBS.  I really enjoyed the simple ingredients yet really good flavor of the meat and sauce.  Will definitely be making it again!

text:
This is a really good recipe and essentially how my family has always made meatloaf.  I know a lot of older folk that also use dry oats if you don't have the bread crumbs or crackers.  The only thing I did differently was add some bell pepper.  I sweated those and the onions in a little butter till soft and then added to the mixture.  I personally don't like to use very lean ground beef because I like the flavor and juices the extra fat gives.  Some reading may also like that or just use it for economic reasons.  I only say this because if you do, like me, you may want to adjust the amount of milk.  Overall, a great go-to recipe and really easy to remember.  Thanks for sharing.

photo:
https://images.media-allrecipes.com/userphotos/50x50/6722625.jpg
city:
None
region:
None
country:
None
text:
The most wonderful thing about meatloaf is its adaptability. This recipe is a great starting point for your own creativity. 

I've made this with finely minced raw onions and I've made it with sweated onions and garlic. I like them both. I add Herbes de Provence and dijon mustard to the meatloaf mix and the sauce. As for breadcrumbs, I use toasted bread. I'm not a big fan of brown sugar for this dish and I like heat, so I added balsamic vinegar, Worcestershire and cayenne pepper to the ketchup and mustard.

Let it rest for 15 minutes before serving and it's simply the best reheated or used cold in a sandwich the next day. (If it lasts that long ... lol)

text:
I found my holy grail meatloaf recipe and who would have guessed it would be such a simple one? Exceeded my expectations!! I wanted to make two loaves so I doubled everything using 1 lb ground beef, 1 lb ground veal and seasoned bread crumbs. Otherwise I followed the recipe exactly. After one hour the loaves were still too pink in the middle so I added about 20 minutes.  This was the most moist meatloaf I've ever had! I did not miss any of the extra ingredients I've used in the past. It was simple in a good way and very flavorful.  I thought the sauce was just perfect and not too sweet.  I was aware some of the reviewers complained about the sweetness so I tasted it a few times while mixing it to make sure I liked it.

I added oatmeal. Whatever amount of meat I'm using, I add half that amount in oatmeal. Meat is expensive these days, so I've gotta stretch it as best I can!  I have a house full of carnivores and they have no idea how much oatmeal I'm adding in. And it's healthy to boot!

city:
None
region:
None
country:
None
text:
I made some adjustments to the recipe and the dish was a huge success.  I added a 1/4cup of Granny Smith apple sauce and 1/2Tbs to the brown sugar mustard ketchup mix.  Also, Lined the bottom of the bread pan with Sliced Italian bread 1 layer, Then coated it with a paste made of 3/4c brown Sugar,1/4c water,1tbs cinnamon, and Italian bread crumbs added to make a paste that was just moist enough to spread on the bread. This soaked up grease from the lean ground meat. I then placed the meatloaf mix in which I only used a 1/2 of a onion diced and a small clove of diced garlic. After the 1hr time, I removed from oven then removed the bread from the bottom, (dumped on plate bottom side up) then recovered with the original pan and placed back in the oven at 225 for approx. 30 minutes while I completed side dishes.  This was the best meatloaf I  have ever made.

text:
I found this receipe in a microwave cookbook many years ago. It is the same recipe except it added one tbsp of Worcestershire sauce. And instead of using brown sugar and mustard, you just pour a little ketchup on top. You cover it with wax paper and microwave it a 70% power for 22-24 minutes, then let it rest for 5 minutes. It is my favorite meatloaf recipe.

text:
I did this recipe mostly as written, however; I had to lightly brown the onions with some garlic in a little coconut oil just because. I also added come Cajun seasoning and my bread crumbs were seasoned. It is great, but; I guess it really wasn't this recipe any more. Thanks for the start.
I hope this helps others: when I have some bread that starts to dry a little, I add all kind of seasoning in a bowl, lightly toast bread so that it will crumble, run it through processor to mix, and put it on cookie sheet to finish drying and store in a hasped jar.That way, you never waste, you decide what seasoning and you never run out,

city:

country:

text:
I have made this close to a dozen times. Easy and the family loves it. I always take a recipe and try to adjust to a personal preference. One thing I did was cook Japanese style rice using this method here http://allrecipes.com/recipe/perfect-sushi-rice/ and I added 2 1/2 cups cooked rice into, it helps it from shrinking and with the rice vinegar added in the rice it sure brings out a wonderful taste. I always add a little more onion since I am an onion lover, same with garlic. I also find if you do not want your meatloaf topping to caramelize, cook the meatloaf and the last 30 minutes pour it on. For some reason also, when making this I never meet the expected cooking time. 1 hour leaves it quite pink, although it could be thicker. Regardless my cooking time is closer to 1 hour 25 minutes. Great recipe and thanks for the share. As we speak the Japanese rice is cooking and the meatloaf for family is being prepared. Along with oven Jerky, homemade mozzarella and ricotta. Beautiful day in the kitchen. Thanks again

text:
I've used this several times now and it's always delicious. I've tweaked it slightly every time until now it's just about perfect.
I add Worcester sauce as well, and topped the loaf with finely chopped green (spring) onions before I bake it. 
Breadcrumbs : I used half regular and half Panko, I'm not sure it made a real difference though. 
Re. the sauce:  We found it to be too sweet if made to the recipe, so the last time I made it, I used tomato puree rather than ketchup, and I dropped the sugar to about 1tbs rather than 2. 
For us that tasted much better, and more natural. 

Thanks so much for the recipe, even though I've added my own twist on it, it's delicious when made exactly to the recipe too.

I usually double this recipe & freeze leftovers in individual servings. It's a quick "grab & go" lunch or dinner. I mince the onions as small as possible & sometimes add other veggies like shredded carrots, minced red peppers & zucchini. Just make sure to blot any excess moisture from any veggies you add. This is a comfort food kind of meatloaf & certainly not one with many distinct flavors. It's quite good though.

country:
None
text:
I modified this greatly based on what I had on hand and my preferences. I used 1 lb of 96% lean meat, 1 diced onion, 1 egg, about 4 slices of 5-grain seeded Italian bread crumbled, about 10 saltine cracker halves, no milk, some sage, parsley and thyme from my garden, a diced small green pepper and a small can of tomato sauce. I used the ketchup topping but mixed in a little vinegar and painted that on the top. I topped it with 2 slices of bacon, because, well bacon (and because my meat was so lean). Oh I also buzzed about 5 mushrooms in the food processor for the mix of meat because I had them. My cooked product put out a lot of moisture, but I poured it off and it was fine.

i love this recipe..i do 2 lbs i stead and half a onion instead.  i add only 3/4 of the meat loaf mixture in to pan then i layer slices of muenster cheese ( add as much cheese that u want i do about 10 oz or so.)then cover it with the remaining meat then add the ketchup sauce on top( i add an brown sugar bbq sauce with the ketchup mixture, add to ur liking)  and i bake for 1 hour and 10 minutes. when i visit my brothers out of town they demand i make it the day i get in. they love it!!!!!! today i'm going to try lay out the meat then top a layer with the shreaded cheese  and then rolling it up into a log then press it in to my baking pan. lets see how it  comes out..experiment and u"ll discover  your own special dish . try it!!! yummy

userID:

Display Name:
LadyCook25
isPro:

photo:
https://images.media-allrecipes.com/userphotos/50x50/5674145.jpg
city:
None
region:
None
country:
None
text:
I had NEVER made a meatloaf before. I was cooking for 4 hungry people and everybody loved it! My dad and our roommate both had seconds and dad had some for lunch the next day. This was SOOOOOO good!
I used 2 lbs of ground beef, 3 eggs, 1 1/4 cup of milk, a packet of onion soup mix 1 1/2 cups of plain bread crumbs with about 3/4 teaspoon of salt, 2 teaspoons of white pepper and 2 teaspoons of garlic powder mixed in it for the meat mixture. I blended all of that with a mixer in medium speed for about 10 minutes.

For the topping I used tomato sauce instead of ketchup. I used 3 tablespoons of brown sugar, 3 tablespoons of plain yellow mustard, and a regular sized can of tomato sauce. 

I swear, it was the best meat loaf I had ever had. It had the most wonderful texture, was juicy and not overdone. The sauce came out marvelously and it was a huge hit with my family. 

Definitely gonna make this meat loaf for my fiance and the inlaws!

I added one cup of slightly sautéed diced portabella mushrooms, one-half cup of diced and slightly sautéed celery, one-half cup of diced green pepper, and fresh minced parsely to the meat mixture. Also, instead of ground beef I used ground bison. For the topping I substituted a mild Chilli sauce for the ketchup and added one teaspoon of Worcestershire sauce to the mustard (Bold and Spicy) and brown sugar. All I can say is ... FANTASTIC!!

Jim

city:

region:

country:
None
text:
I lined a 9x9 pan with foil (big help on the cleanup) and shaped this into a loaf. Since I had 1/2 lb of ground pork from Swedish Meatballs that I made, I used that and 1/2 lb gr beef. I was low on ketchup so I also added a little chili sauce to both the meat and the sauce. Added a few shakes of Worcestershire sauce to the meat, as well as garlic and onion powder. I used a few pieces of crumbled-up bread for the crumbs. Since some said the sauce was a little sweet, I cut back on the brown sugar by 1 TBLSP. Doubling-up on the sauce may be a good idea, because then you'd have extra to spoon over the meat. Very easy, moist and delicious. Thanks Janet!

text:
Great base recipeI doubled the ground beef so I used 3 pounds of 93/7. I also followed some previous reviewer's advice I sautéed the onions added garlic and Bellpepper in butter before adding to meatloaf mixture and a dash or two of Worchestire (spelling?) sauce I also cut back on the amount of breadcrumbs I only used about 1 1/2 cups of seasoned bread crumbs. I did use two eggs and doubled the milk I did also add my own seasonings and just used steak seasoning instead of just salt-and-pepper  I also opted for a brown gravy this time instead of the traditional ketchup sauce. I used an internal baking thermometer and mine was done within about 55 minutes. My four-year-old and my husband enjoyed it!

text:
I made this recipe. Please read to the end, there is good with the bad. In my opinion only a half an onion should be used, wow I did the whole onion as suggested and it was too much! It actually took an hour and half to bake. I let the meat rest while I cooked instant potatoes and corn, the meat was still a bit crumbly. The amount of glaze was enough to cover the loaf, but I needed more to drizzle over the slices once baked, but it was quick to make. The glaze was amazing!! I'll be adjusting this recipe for the next time. Overall it was simple to make and it was a decent meal...if you like lots of onions. Thank you for adding your recipe here!

text:
My husband has told me he didn't like meatloaf, but I wanted to give it a shot myself so used this recipe. The first time around, I messed up and added the mustard to the meat itself, but still ended up delicious! This recipe is very easy and prep time is short. My substitutes are 1 packet of onion soup mix (instead of the onion), stone ground mustard (instead of reg mustard. Gives a kick) and seasoned bread crumbs (instead of reg bread crumbs). I don't add any salt or pepper to it.

text:
As always, I didnt leave this recipe alone. I added 3 pieces of chopped crisp bacon to the meat mixture and I used the grease to saute the onions with a some Mrs.Dash. I also added 3 splashes of Worcestershire sauce and because I didnt read the instructions I added a tbsp. of brown mustard to the meat. In addition, I used seasoned breadcrumbs in place of plane. I doubled the ketchup and brown sugar but only used about 1 1/2 tbsp. mustard in the topping. Baked in a loaf pan and not free formed this was a wonderful meatloaf! Its my new go-to recipe for meatloaf.

text:
This was EXCELLENT. Moist, easy to make, and my picky 9 and 11 year olds asked for seconds!! I followed some of the other's suggestions...cut the mustard amount in half, doubled the sauce for the top, increased baked time to 1 1/2 hours, added a tablespoon of worcestershire to the meat mixture, and sauteed' the onions with a little garlic before I added them to the meat mixture. I let the whole thing rest about 10 min after it came out of the oven, before I cut into it.  Deeeeeelishhh!

Display Name:

photo:
https://images.media-allrecipes.com/userphotos/50x50/5614254.jpg
city:
None
region:
None
country:
None
text:
I make this recipe or some variation of it everytime I make a meatloaf.  I must say that this TYPICALLY turns out excellent.  The only time it doesn't is when it is my fault and I mix the ingredients too much and the meatloaf comes out lacking in texture.  Some of the variations that I have done in the past... grate the onion instead of chop it gives the onion flavor without the crunch, use 1/2 lb sausage one lb beef instead of 1 1/2 lb beef (changes up the spices a little).  In the summer I add fresh basil and thyme. 
I do vary the sauce a little when I make this.. I cut the brown sugar down to 1 T and I add 1 T of A1 in place of one of the T's of Mustard (just personal preference).

All in all- excellent recipe.

Easy to make - I used Shredded cheese ( Mexican blend) in stead of milk, plus 1/3c. Katsup in side loaf, cooked brown rice in place of bread/crackers, added an extra egg, and made double the topping.

text:
I took the advice of others and cooked the onions in a pan (in low heat, just till they become clear) first, and it makes a BIG difference. The consistency is perfect with the addition of the milk. Hint: good chopped meat makes good meatloaf. Don't cheap out! Get the good sirloin and it makes a great difference. This is now a family favorite in our home.

text:
I have made this several times, but have altered it slightly each time.  Last night was the best--I only had a pound of hamburger (93% lean) so I used that and sautéd the onions as others have mentioned, added Worcestershire sauce, a little ketchup and garlic powder, and replaced the bread crumbs with a cup of stovetop stuffing mix for chicken.  I also added a handful of quick cooking oats, which makes it nice and light.  We prefer the standard ketchup to the top instead of the sauce, but it was a huge hit.

text:
After reading comments, I sauteed the onions (I actually sauteed them in onion soup mix with a little oil and butter-- weird, I know, but I think it added a great flavor). Also added worchestershire. The reviews had me a little concerned about the sauce, so I didn't make a ton of it-- huge mistake-- the sauce was delicious. I will definitely double the recipe next time-- I did use brown mustard instead of prepared. Hubby doesn't like mustard at all, so I didn't want to give any indication that the recipe contained mustard). I also used italian seasoned breadcrumbs. my only complaint-- it was really greasy with chuck-- next time, I will use the 93% lean meat and hope that it doesn't come out too dry. I did use the loaf pan-- maybe I would lose some of the grease if I cooked it in a 9x13?

text:
My wife loved it. i messed up and mixed all the wet ingredients then folded in the meat, bread crumbs, etc. I did not realize the ketchup (i used spaghetti sauce) and mustard were for the glaze, oops!  but it still tasted great and no harm no foul. i only baked for about 30-35 minutes because i modified the recipe by putting the meatloaf into a muffin pan. it made 16 meatloaf muffins and they are easier to handle and portion out. ensure you butter (or spray) the pan beforehand for easier removal.

i'll be making this again soon. it is going into the rotation.

text:
Made the meatloaf; doubled the recipe. I did follow suggestions in the reviews: sautéed onions ahead, added garlic powder and Worcestershire and I used a mixture of croutons/seasoned bread crumbs/saltines.  For the topping, I reduced the amount of mustard (I have this "thing" about mustard). The meatloaf was delicious! Best ever!  My husband actually lied to my adult son by stating that it had "entirely too much onion" in it just so he wouldn't want any, thereby securing his 2nd helping that night and plenty on the following evening. Come on fellow cooks, you know something's good when people lie in order to prevent anyone else from eating any! 
A must-try! Happy cooking!

text:
Very basic and not very flavorful as written. I added Worcestershire sauce, peppers and garlic as some had suggested, and it was still not that flavorful - can't imagine what it would have been like without.  I would have liked a little direction as to the quantity of salt and pepper, since you can't taste a raw hamburger mixture to gauge how much to add as you would soup. As for the sauce on top, you can do as well with a good barbecue sauce - or for that matter - dabbing some ketchup on top. I did like the suggestion to add milk, had never heard of that, and it did add some moisture to the recipe. Will continue to look for a meatloaf recipe that's got a little more going for it.

text:
Absolutely love it! I tried it the first time just as is, only adding red bell peppers and it was amazing!  Oh, I did forget to add the sauce on top until the last 10 minutes and it still turned out great. I've also tried it with the suggestions: sautéing onions and garlic, adding the Worcestershire sauce, and bell peppers and it was also great. Again, I didn't add the sauce until the last 10 minutes only because I had done that the previous time and I really loved it. I feel that I tend to have more control of sweetness that way. I love sweet food so I sometimes double up the sauce. My hubby likes it with less sauce and my little girl likes it with almost no sauce, she scoops it right off. Anyway, it's a winner in my family's tummy. Thank you!  :)

text:
I also sauteed the onions and instead of mustard and brown sugar I used a couple table spoons of BBQ sauce in the ketchup on top. Also I added a half cup of parmesan and a couple table spoons of ketchup into the meatloaf to. It was so moist and cohesive flavor between the BBQ and parmesan. Also sometimes I put a bacon layer on top when there's twenty minutes left. I also tried it by the recipe exactly and it wasn't nearly as good because the meatloaf was a plain okay cheeseburger flavor and the sauce was too sweet. So this revised version is definitely my main meatloaf recipe now.

text:
This was awesome. I need a few changes based on other reviews: I sautéed one whole white onion with some butter and fresh thyme.  I sautéed some finely chopped mushrooms and garlic in butter. I added one table of Worcestershire sauce to the meat. I used 4 teaspoons instead of 2 tablespoons of brown sugar. I handed up having to cook it for an hour and 10 minutes. Also I put the whole loaf over some mushroom slices. It was really moist with a great flavor. I think next time I'll make some extra sauce in case somebody wants to use a little on their plate but honestly the flavor of the meat itself was so good it probably doesn't need more sauce.

text:
Yesterday I followed this recipe but the meatloaf came moist but too crumbly and bland. So today I did the following:  (1) Sautéed the garlic. (2) Added sautéed green peppers. (3) Added mined garlic. (4) Added fresh minced jalapeño. (5) Added dried oregano. (6) Let the meatloaf sit for 10 minutes (before cutting)  after I removed it from the oven. The tweeks mentioned below created a tasteful, exciting meatloaf! Can't wait to share with folks.

For someone that doesn't really like meatloaf I thought this was great. My hubby who is a meatloaf fanatic didn't like it as much. I would make this again but maybe use less milk to get a different texture and no garlic. This was very moist and had a good flavor even without all the onion the recipe called for.

text:
I made this recipe but substituted ground turkey and pork sausage.  I also sautéed garlic, onions and red pepper.  I had some left over quinoa, carrots and didn't have any bread crumbs around so I used 2 lunch bag size of Sun Chips crushed for the replacement. I also added the Worcestershire to the mix.  In the sauce I have played with the mustards; I did separately grey poupon and durkee. They were both fantastic.  Now my husband always says that I never make a meal the same twice. (He's right)  I thought I would write it down so that I wouldn't forget.  It was delicious.  I have saved this one in my recipe box for sure. Moist, Juicy, and Delicious! Hopefully I will get close when I repeat it.  I can't wait for the sandwiches for leftovers.  MA from STL

text:
Like most of the reviewers, I modified my seasonings to my tastes, however, I added the ketchup/mustard/brown sugar topping after 40 minutes of cooking. Still seeps into the loaf a bit, but does not dry out to a gooey paste on top. Still perfecting it, but basic recipe is great. sauteing onions prior to adding to mix is a huge plus to flavor. adding some garlic does the same, either straight to the mix or to the onions prior to saute. Worcester sauce seems to add to flavor too (I call it my secret ingredient, though it isn't too secret, since I tell everybody).

text:
Soak the bread crumps into the milk for about half an hour before mixing (including the not absorbed milk) with the other ingredients. The roast gets more juicy and fluffy. I also added mustard, Worcestershire Sauce (if available you can also use MAGGI), thyme, basil, Oregano and marjoram (1 teaspoon of each).

userID:
14007498
Display Name:
hardcoredore
isPro:
False
followersCount:
0

1

photo:
https://images.media-allrecipes.com/userphotos/50x50/1307015.jpg
city:
None
region:
None
country:
None
text:
I must say I was very excited about this recipe as I really LOVE meatloaf. I took most of the suggestions of other users with regards to sauteing the onion before mixing it, using seasoned bread crumbs, and doubling the topping mixture (with a little less mustard). 

First off I must say that I'm not an inexperienced cook. I cooked professionally for about 10 years in my early 20's. I have however never made a meatloaf before. I don't know why, I just haven't. I had 2 lbs of nice ground chuck so I changed the recipe's ingredients slightly to account for the extra meat. I used the following in the actual loaf: 

2 pounds ground beef
 1-1/4 egg
 1-1/4 onion, chopped
 1-1/4 cups milk
 1-1/4 cups dried bread crumbs
 salt and pepper to taste

Once i had combined the toppings for the loaf, I noticed that it was quite mushy/liquid like. The instructions say to form it into a loaf if you are using a 9x13 inch pain instead of a loaf pan. Forming it into a loaf was not an option, so I just did the best I could to get it evenly into the pan. I'm not sure why it was so liquidy.

As far as the topping I used guldens spicy brown mustard, instead of a regular yellow mustard. I think maybe this hurt the flavor profile of the topping considerably. I shouldn't have done this, but oh well. 

I just really wasn't too impressed by the finished product. I think adding the extra meat was possibly the culprit. I do think that adding some additional bread crumbs may have helped, but IDK... Thoughts?

Finally,  I baked it for one hour and twenty minutes at 350 degrees.

I made meatloaf muffins with this recipe and it filled 12 muffin tins nicely. As muffins it took 40 minutes to cook. It probably could have gone 5 minutes longer as the "crust" wasn't as crispy as I like. 

The taste was not bad, though only one of my 4 kids really enjoyed it. The only change I made was adding 1 Tbsp of worcestershire to the meat. It was still pretty bland, though. I probably could have added more salt and pepper but didn't know how to season it to taste without tasting it!! I will keep looking.

text:
OK, this is a basic recipe and I took other comments into consideration when I made this.  I did sauté garlic, bell peppers, onion and garlic to add to the meatloaf mixture.  I lowered the amount of mustard to 1 Tbsp, 3/4 C milk, and did 2/3 C of ketchup.  I also added Worcestershire sauce with Italian seasoning and parsley.  I first made this for my aunt and cousin (picky eaters) and they couldn't get enough.  She even asked for the recipe because there were no left overs.  I have made this several times for my husband (a true meat and potatoes man) and he loved it.  I am actually making it again tonight.  I have made fancier, more expensive, recipes, and after trying so many, this is it.

text:
This was the first meatloaf I've ever made, and it was AWESOME! I remember having meatloaf as a kid and not liking it much...I always remembered it being dry and/or blah. For some reason I recently got a craving for it and I made this recipe for my boyfriend and myself. We both loved it! So moist and flavorful! I made it with garlic red mashed potatoes and roasted asparagus. The easiest and most delicious meal! As far as this recipe goes, I only had one pound of ground beef so I cut the milk and breadcrumbs down to 3/4 cup each, which worked great. For the sauce, I also added a big dash of Worcestershire sauce and Sricha for a slight spice. This is going in my regular rotation of favorite recipes!!!

https://images.media-allrecipes.com/userphotos/50x50/5674151.jpg
city:
None
region:
None
country:
None
text:
Good easy recipe. I did change a few things. I sauteed the onions, added 2 tablespoons of Worcestershire sauce to meat mixture, doubled the amount of the ketchup sauce, and cooked for an hour and thirty minutes.  I found that only cooking it for an hour made the meatloaf a little soggy. After it was done cooking i made another batch of the ketchup sauce, heated it on the stove for a minute or two, and poured it over the sliced pieces of meatloaf.  Without the extra sauce it was a little bland. Husband loved it so overall it was a success. Served it with mashed potatoes and corn!

-saute onion with a little butter
- used italian seasoned breadcrumbs
-double the ketchup and only slightly reduced the mustard. I also used coarse ground mustard
-add Worcestershire sauce

I didn't double the sauce, it is fairly strong (perfect match to the meatloaf though) and felt it didn't need the extra sauce.

text:
Wayyyy too much milk.  A whole cup? I followed the recipe to a T, and it came out mushy and almost unrecognizable as real ground beef.  So far, I've had to put it back in the oven twice - the first time it was in the oven, uninterrupted for a full hour.  I do like the sauce on top, but right now Im baking it just to dry it out enough to make it edible.  And as for the salt & pepper to taste? I don't like to taste raw hamburger to get a feel for whether it's salty enough or not.  Maybe it would be helpful to start off with say, a teaspoon of each and then people can add more or less the next time they make it?

text:
Very good. I have tried many meatloaf recipes but never moist enough. I used this recipe and sautéed the onion along with some of green pepper and mushrooms I needed to use up. Added a pinch of granulated garlic, onion powder and Worcestershire sauce and my family raved about it. I used the sauce recipe and added a tablespoon of medium hot wing sauce so it wasn't so sweet. I also used silicone muffin pans, put a indentation in the middle of each ball of meat so they don't swell up and it holds the sauce. Cooks in less time. I will use this recipe every time and just tweak it slightly.

text:
Very good! I made this because I didn't have much in the house but I did have about 1 1/4lb of ground beef...so meatloaf it is.  Only changes I made was that I sautéed the onion with some garlic, I got that idea from Ina Garten. I really liked the topping so next time I think I'd double that. Some reviews said it was too sweet but I thought it complimented the meat nicely. I served it with mashed potatoes, of course. I'm looking forward to the leftovers tonight! This will probably become my go to recipe! Thanks!

Update: I make this recipe all the time. But recently tried it as meatloaf muffins, and it was great. Just placed the ingredients in a  muffin pan, to make individual servings. 450 degrees for 20 mins and Perfect.

userID:
13179504
Display Name:
Paulina Pelaez
isPro:
False
followersCount:
1
followingCount:

region:

country:

text:
I had never had meatloaf before in my entire life (I'm 22) but I had a lot of ground beef in the freezer. So I decided I would make meatloaf. I only cook for my boyfriend so it's imperative that he likes what I cook or else I feel bad. He has a very simple palate and I usually cook from recipes that are made for kids (he loves all of them) but this recipe looked simple enough for me to make and for him to eat.

This meatloaf was a success. I used italian style breadcrumbs and 2 eggs instead of 1, I'm also pretty sure I used 2 pounds of beef. Well since I had never made meatloaf before the timer started off with 1 1/2 hours. Now I know I had to cook it for probably 2 1/2 because I used more beef. It was a teensy bit raw so I popped it back in at a high temp (425) while some potatoes were cooking. I doubled the sauce but I bought spicy mustard and I thought the mustard was a bit too overpowering when I tasted the sauce, I poured it on anyway and crossed my fingers. The sauce tasted awesome cooked, I guess the heat brought out the sugar in the sauce. 

I took the advice some of the other reviewers made and put in about 1 1/2 tbsp of Worcestershire sauce. Plenty of salt and paper. I didn't saute the onions but I think that was the right move because they were kinda crunchy and brought a lot of flavor to the meatloaf. My boyfriend whom is not a fan of onions didn't mention the fact that there were onions in there! He absolutely loved the meatloaf and the sauce on top of it.

text:
Good as-is, and has all the parts of a standard meatloaf recipe so it's easy to customize. I used 1lb of ground turkey and 1/2lb ground beef, and only half an onion (1 cup) because it was large. I sauteed the onion (until translucent) with 6 thick-cut slices of bacon which I had diced (about 6oz) and 2 tsp of minced garlic. I used Italian seasoned breadcrumbs and 1/2 tsp each salt and pepper, and added 1/4 tsp each onion powder and granulated garlic. I reduced the milk considerably (to 1/3 cup) and made the sauce with 1/2 cup ketchup, 3 tbsp yellow mustard and 2 tbsp brown sugar. I shaped the meat into two small loaves, topped them with 2/3 of the sauce, and baked 1 hour, adding the remaining sauce after 45 minutes.

text:
Good basic recipe, easy to tweak to your own tastes.  I added a second egg to the mixture, along with a clove of garlic and a dash of worchestershire sauce.  As some have suggested, I sautéed the onion first.  I also substituted a little salsa for part of the ketchup, cut back on the mustard, and added a dash of worchestershire sauce. Served with mashed potatoes:  comfort food at its best!

text:
My family can not get enough of this recipe! I make this probably every other week.  The only things I do differently is, I use 2 lbs of beef, since we buy beef in bulk and it comes in 1 lb packages.  But, that is one of the reasons I love all-recipes, you can adjust the number of servings, and it will adjust all the other ingrediants for you, however, in this case, you can't do 1/25 eggs, so I use on egg and one egg white.  
I also put the loaf into my pampered chef 4 mini loaf stone.  Doing this gives me a lot more surface area to put the topping on, so I double the topping ingredients and slather it on....some people commented about not liking the topping....for our family, that is what makes this recipe so great!  Everyone we make this for requests the recipe...so it is a hit with others as well.

10060109
Display Name:
love2cook

https://images.media-allrecipes.com/userphotos/50x50/5674138.jpg
city:
None
region:
None
country:
None
text:
I expected more, based on the reviews. I made a double batch of this, and added Worcestershire sauce to one of them. It wasn't anything special, but perhaps with some tweaking, it would be pretty good. I did use seasoned bread crumbs. I think if I make this again, I would cut back 1/4-1/2 cup of the breadcrumbs and the milk. It almost gave it a bit of a mushy texture; not firm like meat. If you like it like that, fine; but if you like a firmer consistency, I would lighten those 2 things up. I will also add some seasonings next time, and I think with those few changes, it would be a lot better. Good starting base though. Oh, and the sauce basically just tastes like what you would imagine ketchup and mustard and sugar would taste like mixed together. Not horrible, but nothing special.
2nd time- doubled the batch, except for the crumbs and milk; kept those at 1c each. Added 1/2 tsp garlic powder, 1 tsp onion powder, 1.5 tsp italian seasoning, and 2 good teaspoons of minced garlic. Also takes about 1hr 20-30 min to cook, 2 loaf pans for double batch. Flavor was better this time, texture wasn't mushy, but, it wasn't firm like meatloaf, it fell apart when slicing, but tasted great.When I took it out of the oven, there was liquid about 3/4 way up pan,so I'm glad I didn't double the milk! On 3rd try, I may add more crumbs, or cook a bit longer just for firmness. Taste was much better 2nd time than 1st. also ommited wor.sauce this time.

text:
This was really good. My mom rest her soul used to make my favorite meatloaf, but I never watched her make it (mad at myself).  I have been craving it lately. Went to a diner and had it, but it just wasn't the same. So thankful that I found this recipe. Full disclosure, I always read the reviews, so I changed some things based on those, as well as what I had on hand. I made this tonight and it was so yummy! I used ground turkey and for some reason, I didn't expect there to be as much grease as there was, but I read that bread on the bottom of the pan will sop it up. I used only a 1/2 cup of milk and mixed Italian bread crumbs with panko. Next time I will try oatmeal (was all out). I seasoned with pepper, italian herbs, garlic, paprika, and kosher salt. I mistakenly added kosher salt thinking it was panko (mixed up the boxes), but thank God it didn't mess up the meat. I didn't have steak sauce or Worcestershire sauce, so I used chili sauce instead. Will DEFINITELY stick with that. I also added some carrot and green pepper and will add red pepper next time. I like the idea of adding veggies. I also topped it with Sweet Baby Ray bbq sauce. I originally baked it for one hour, but didn't feel it was done, so I did another 20 minutes, and then an addition 10. So delish! My dad had seconds first and my 6 yr old nephew (who barely eats) had seconds. Thank you for this recipe and all of the reviewers who experimented with it. It's a keeper!

text:
I sauteed the onions with a little garlic and diced bell pepper (had a pepper to use that I didn't want to spoil) before adding to the ground beef.  I was out of seasoned bread crumbs, so I added a couple dashes of Itialian seasoning and used oatmeal.  I thought the amount of milk might make the meatloaf mushy but the oats absorbed the liquid well and it came out very moist but definately not mushy.  This is an EASY recipe as the title implies and is very good as well as versatile from the slight changes I made.  I might decrease the amount of brown sugar next time as I thought it was a little sweet.  I will make this recipe part of my monthly recipe rotation.

text:
okay i am rating this a 5 but that is only without the sauce on top i made this for my boyfriend and his father for dinner and here is what i did. 1. added 2 tbs of Worcestershire sauce. also when i browned the onions i did it in 1 tbsp of butter and added the salt and pepper to those and put in a little garlic to taste. and then added that to the meat mixture. for a little flare and something different i minced some mushroom and added that. after all was said and done i have literally made this 3 nights in a row and have only gotten 2 pieces. but i do warn you do not use the sauce on it not tasty. if you like ketchup add it to your plate after.

Delicious!! Easy recipe that is a crowd pleaser! Followed the recipe with the following additions: 1. As suggested, chopped onion and some garlic cloves were sautéed first 2. I made extra sauce, just eyeballed more ketchup and a 1/3 more brown sugar plus spices. 3. Added shredded carrots and shredded zucchini to sneak in more veggies. 4.  Used the "as seen on TV perfect meatloaf pan", it cooked evenly and the excess fat accumulated on the bottom while the meat cooked on a rack on top. Very moist and delicious!!!

text:
I made this recipe last night and I have mixed reviews. The meatloaf itself was wonderful(based on other reviews I added 2 Tbsp of Worcestershire Sauce & that made it yummy). I also doubled the sauce because I like a substantial tomato sauce on top. Doubling gave the perfect amount of sauce. What I didn't like was the brown sugar (and I ADORE anything with Brown Sugar in it). And I actually HALVED the amount of sugar and STILL FOUND IT TOO SWEET for my taste. I would simply use Tomato Paste next time I make this...and I definitely will make this again. I used a loaf pan and ended up cooking this for 85 mins.

I don't know if it's me being pregnant but I wasn't a fan of this recipe... My first time making a meatloaf and I was happy how it finished. I used somewhat of the same recipe, but I added mushrooms, cut onion and garlic in the mixture. It gave more taste, spiced it up and gave it a little twist! I even cut down the brown sugar to 1tbs instead of 2tbs. 
Looked perfect, sauce was amazing and the mix was delicious. I'm just sad that I didn't leave it in another 5 or maybe 10 minutes, it was to moist for me. Although my fiance thinks it was amazing and flawless! He thinks it deserves a 4/5.

Display Name:

photo:
https://images.media-allrecipes.com/userphotos/50x50/5674137.jpg
city:
None
region:
None
country:
None
text:
I just mixed this together with the following substitutions: 3lb ground beef , 1T Italian seasoning, 1t thyme, 1T dried onion , 1T Duck Dynasty Cajun seasoning,plus more sprinkled on top, 1t.onion powder, 1t chives, I used 2 eggs,mixed with about 2/3 C milk, and 1C bread crumb,plain, as I didn't have seasoned. For the sauce/glaze I used 1/2 c ketchup,1/2 c grape jelly,2T white sugar, 1/4 cup Italian dressing,2T steak sauce. ( it all sounds gross, but boil it down until it is thick, and top the meatloaf with it at the last twenty mins of baking.) Trust me, everyone I have ever made this for goes nuts for it, and begs for my secret recipe. I usually make cocktail meatballs with this glaze, and people come at me with marriage proposals, gifts, bribes, etc. I can't tell you how my meatloaf turned out, as it is baking now.......will update later....

text:
I made this recipe for the first time for a dinner I had with my in-laws and I was so embarrassed. After following the recipe exactly, this did not turn out. I had high hopes because of the high rating, it was simple to make, it looked great, smelled great but we did not care for the flavor. You couldn't taste the meat at all. My suggestion would be to cut down on the breadcrumbs and milk or eliminate them altogether. My husband asked me not to make it again and stick to the way I've been making it. I learned my lesson, I won't make a new recipe for company without trying it first!

text:
At 59 years old, I've probably made 100s of meatloaves.  To me this is a great basic recipe.  It is very good, as is, or one could spice it up to their personal taste.  I cut the onions small enough that they were thoroughly cooked within the loaf. The overall flavor, moisture and texture was to my liking.  Next time I make a meatloaf I'll use this recipe and if I want it to have a differnent "flair" I'll add herbs/spices/other ingredients accordingly.

photo:
https://images.media-allrecipes.com/userphotos/50x50/5677179.jpg
city:
None
region:
None
country:
None
text:
Great recipe! These were the changes I made to it:
1. Only used 1/2 an onion and I sautéed it before adding to the burger mixture
2. Used Italian seasoned breadcrumbs
3. Added 1 Tbsp of Worcestershire sauce to meat mixture
4. Added 1 tsp. of both salt and pepper to meat mixture
5. Used 1/2 cup ketchup and 1 Tbsp of mustard for topping
6. Make sure meat mixture is pushed down well in loaf pan
7. Cook for 60-65 minutes or until edges start to brown

ENJOY!!!

text:
Really liked this recipe, except the sauce was way too sweet! Both my husband and I had the same reaction to sauce. Second time, I didnt use brown sugar at all and instead added 1 tbsp soy sauce (to both meat and sauce). This greatly improved the recipe! Also, followed the advice of other reviews and sauteed onions first with garlic & butter, used seasoned bread crumbs, and doubled the sauce recipe - all worked great! Meat comes out really juicy and tender, which I really liked!

text:
I had (and lost) this recipe from a number of years back, the only variation you might want to do is to add a 1/2 tsp of sage to the milk and eggs and onion before mixing into the meat.  Cook for an hour, drain the goop, put the topping on then let it cook for another ten minutes or so.  I have also used 1 tsp of dry mustard instead of prepared as well.  Great as is or with my variation

text:
This is an outstanding recipe. Before making it I had never eaten meatloaf I enjoyed before, let alone tried making it myself. What a success! I sauteed the onions before adding them, and made the recipe gluten-free by using gluten-free breadcrumbs instead. I also added double-smoked bacon pieces and diced apple, both of which added some phenomenal flavour. The topping mixture was amazingly tasty; I was somewhat leery because I don't like ketchup, but everything combined into a great dish. Served it with mashed potatoes and roasted veggies. Will definitely be making this one again!

This is so similar to what I make, with the exception that I seldom add bread.  Instead I add dry Mrs. Grass dry chicken soup (with only half the pkgd spice inside)and I can't remember but if it has a capsule inside, I generally poke it and add half to hamburg mix.  If too runny, then I had a few crumbled soda crackers.  
Sometimes I bake extra in cupcake pans and after cooled I freeze them in freezer bags for future use.

https://images.media-allrecipes.com/userphotos/50x50/5674157.jpg
city:
None
region:
None
country:
None
text:
My family loved this meatloaf! My 3 year old is very picky. He skips dinner most of the time, however, he ate an entire piece of this meatloaf!! If he doesn't like something, he simply won't eat it, and he ate all of his piece!! My husband even said it was delicious, and was hesitant because of the brown sugar! I did not read the reviews before I made it, due to the lack of time, but I did change the recipe a little, similar to the others. 1) I added seasoned bread crumbs (we only use seasoned bread crumbs) 2) I did not have an onion so I added garlic powder, onion powder, season salt, and some other seasonings that we use often. 3) I added Worcestershire sauce. I don't measure, I just add about a tablespoon, maybe two. 5) I buy packaged meat from the meat market in 1 pound packages, so I used 2 pounds of meat, instead of 1 1/2. 6) I also added ketchup & mustard to the meat. I thought the topping was perfectly fine, I think it would have been too sweet if I doubled it..DEFINITELY RECOMMEND!

text:
It didn't have quite as much flavour as I had hoped, and was rather greasy (I even used lean ground beef), but otherwise, a splendid dish. The topping with ketchup and brown sugar was good as well, though some don't seem to like it. I found it had the perfect amount of sweetness to offset the beef flavour. It could definitely use a little more spices. I would suggest garlic powder, more pepper, and maybe even some good herbs.

text:
I am not fond of toppings on meatloaf, so I skipped the glaze. But to add some flavour I add 3 tbsp. of steak spice to the meatloaf mix to give it a bit of impact. Used oatmeal filler, and beef\pork\veal mixture - 1/3 each. Added garlic powder and lots of onion and a bit of sage. Stays moist but stays together when sliced. Partner used a tomato sauce on his. On the whole, a good meatloaf, tender and more flavourful with the pork and veal added.

text:
i did follow it some what, reduced the brown sugar, chopped up some onion celery and muzhrooms and green bell peppers, sauteed them, and drained on paper towel, colled them off and added to hamburger mixture with the milk oh! sauteed garlic with other vegies, made extra sauce, put some on the bottom and on the top then added a little more ketchup (love it on meat loaf) baked it it to the beef temp, turned out great, and the next day for lunch, i made open faced meat loaf sandwitches, a piece of lightly toasted texas toast, added the meat loaf, and had some beef stock and thickened it with a little cornstarch (you could use flour) and poured it over the meat loaf, yummy!

region:
None
country:
None
text:
I have tried many different meatloaf recipes, and this one has become my go-to. It's moist, flavorful, easy, & delicious. I like it because you can leave the milk/breadcrumb mixture the same and add or subtract other ingredients if you like. I don't add as many onions when cooking for my daughter or will substitute some minced onion instead. I also season the meat with garlic powder and Worcestershire. For the topping, I double the sauce and decrease the mustard by half as to make it less like a hamburger taste.  I also shape into mini loaves so there's more sauce for meat. YUMMMMMMM

text:
This was my first time making meatloaf but I decided to modify the recipe some as others suggested. 

1) I used bison ground instead of beef and I used 2 lbs instead of 1.5 bc it comes in 1 lb packages. I just used a little more breadcrumbs. 

2) added Worcestershire , smoked paprika and oregano to meat mixture. 

3) doubled the sauce recipe

The only thing I would change is to not use a bread pan but make a loaf in a cooking sheet. The fat that cooked off just stayed in the bottom of the pan and it was a little greasy.  Kept it juicy mind you but a little too much grease.

Display Name:
Elysia

photo:
https://images.media-allrecipes.com/userphotos/50x50/5674167.jpg
city:
None
region:
None
country:
None
text:
First time i made this i did it exactly as stated but now for the 5th time i think i have my personal preferences ironed out.  I love onion so i use 1 1/2 onion sauteed with minced garlic in butter until softened.  I also add 1 tbs of Worcestershire sauce to the meat.  The sauce is a bit too sweet for my tastes so i only use 1 tbs of brown sugar just a splash of water to make it easier to pour and also a dash of more Worcestershire sauce along with the mustard and ketchup.  I then put a layer of meat, half the sauce mixture, another layer of meat then the rest of the sauce.  This keeps it extra moist. :)

text:
I have made this countless times and love it!  I use a meatloaf mix from my market that has bell pepper, seasoning and some onion in the ground beef.  In a medium bowl I beat the egg and stir in the seasoned bread crumbs and milk and add a package of beefy onion from Lipton or Mrs. Grass.  I mix that all up and add the meat and mix it together and then add the worcestershire sauce and form in a pyrex dish.  For the topping I do what is stated but add a few squirts of sriracha to give it a little kick.  SO GOOD!!!

text:
This recipe was pretty much the same (except I used only a tablespoon of minced onion) as I have always made my meatloaves. The new twist is the glaze! I only changed it a bit by adding a touch of molasses, and it was very tasty and my husband loved it. At about 40 minutes into the cooking time, I added a bit of water to keep it from scorching and it really made it moist. Also, I added Worcester, parsley and oregano into the meatloaf mix. And after the glaze was spread on I sprinkled on more oregano and parsley.

text:
This recipe will replace the one I've been using for the past 20 years!  It was excellent.  The only changes I made were to use just 1 T of mustard and in place of bread crumbs, I used oatmeal (trying to eat wheat-free).  Next time I will take the advice of another reviewer and sauté the onions before adding to the meat mixture.  I also had more meat than what would fit in my loaf pan so I made individual meat loafs with a muffin pan (reduced baking time by about 20 minutes).  My son, who does NOT like meat loaf loved this recipe.  Thanks for sharing!!

I make this all the time, and made it yesterday for my family, we love this recipe! text:
Super easy. I had never eaten or prepared meatloaf before, and this recipe was a hit. My boyfriend loved it.
I added about 1 tbsp Worcestershire sauce, a good sprinkling of granulated garlic, and about 2 tbsp of BBQ sauce to the meat.
I didn't sauté the onions and they turned out nice and soft for me- wouldn't sauté them next time either as it adds extra time/dishes and I thought it tasted great without.
Extra sauce is definitely a good idea.
Great recipe overall, simple and delicious.

This recipe was awesome! I also added green bell pepper and sautéed the onion and bell peppers together first. I also used real bread and sliced it into tiny bread pieces as well as seasoned bread crumbs (about 1/2 and 1/2.) I am a huge cheese lover and so is my boyfriend so I layered about an inch of meatloaf then a 1/2 inch of cheese over and over again until I ran out of meatloaf. The cheese was my favorite part. I used Monterey Jack. The ketchup/mustard/brown sugar sauce was so yummy I made extra to top it off when it came out of the oven. My boyfriend was highly impressed with how good it was. I tried this recipe today and we really enjoyed it. I followed the suggestions from others and sauteed the onions,garlic and green bell pepper. I added only 1/2c of milk because I didn't want it to be mushy. I also added a dash of worcestershire sauce to the meat mix.  I made the topping using only 1 tbsp of brown sugar and equal parts ketchup/mustard. It was perfect! The loaf was nice and firm, tasty and juicy. I would recommend this recipe to anyone looking for an easy and quick meatloaf. I will definitely make this again.

text:
This was the best meatloaf I have made. Absolutely delicious. Taking the advice of other users I did make a few changes. 1. I used lean ground turkey. 2. Sauteed a half onion and a 1/2 bellpepper with 1 teaspoon of minced garlic and butter. 3. Added 2 teaspoons of Worcestshire sauce and 1 teaspoon of Heinze 57 to meat mixture along with seasoning. 4. Only used 2 teaspoons of light brown sugar to 1 cup of Ketchup and 1 teaspoon of Worcestshire sauce for topping ***you will want to make extra topping** 5. Cooked for 1 hour and 30 minutes and drained excess liquid mid way through. Soooo moist but not falling apart. Very Good!

This has been the only meatloaf recipe that's has been a success!  I've made it three times now and will be making a  a cupcake version for Easter tomorrow. The only addition that I added was 2 mild sausages just to give it a little kick. I also added a few gulps of worcestershire sauce. The topping was fine as well I used just a little less mustard. Highly recommend trying this recipe.

text:
I made this recipe and it was the most moist meatloaf I have ever made. I only slightly changed a few things that I don't think would have made much of a difference in the overall result. 1. I used 1 lb. ground pork and 1 lb. ground venison. 2. I used 2 eggs instead of 1 because I used more meat, and 3. I didn't use table salt because I try to follow low sodium diets, but I did add garlic. My husband loved this meat loaf and he didn't think that the sauce topping was too sweet. Also, I got the new meatloaf pan (as seen on t.v.) for Christmas and christened it with this recipe. I totally recommend this meatloaf, (and the new pan lol). Easy and delicious!

photo:
https://images.media-allrecipes.com/userphotos/50x50/1989204.jpg
city:
None
region:
None
country:
None
text:
This is a good basic recipe to start for a good meatloaf.  I added a few more ingredients in it - 1 tbsp of Worcestershire sauce, 1/2 tsp smoked paprika, 1/2 tsp dry mustard powder, 1 tsp garlic powder.  I also used only 3/4 cup of whole milk and seasoned bread crumbs.  I also took the advice of others and sauteed the onions first (threw in some fresh garlic as well).  It did take about an 1 1/2 hours to get it to 160 degrees.  I didn't make the glaze as both my husband and I do not like sweet on our meatloaf. I made a brown gravy instead and served it with that.  It was very good.

text:
Made this with elk burger(we are hunters). It turned out great! We also made some of the alterations some of the others said. Used plain bread crumbs, added 2 TBS Worcestershire sauce, added chopped green peppers, green onions. We sauteed the onions first, just cause i didnt want a crunchy meatloaf. Added plenty of salt and pepper, garlic powder, and dried parsley. People are saying the topping is too sweet but i loved it! Perfect topping for this meatloaf. I recommend letting it set for 15 minutes after cooking so it can set up. Overall a great recipe!!

text:
Very Good!!  I too sauted the onion with garlic in butter and doubled the sauce.  When doubling the sauce, I doubled the ketchup but only 3 tablespoons of brown sugar and mustard.  Depending on you sweetness meter, you could get away with not doubling the brown sugar.  I had a package of ground beef that was 2.25 lbs.  When shaping, I flattened to about 3", which will be perfect when using the leftovers for sandwiches, and it was done in 1 hour.

text:
This is the first time I am actually taking the time to comment on a recipe. This was PHENOMENAL! Thank you to everyone who wrote a review because that helped me make the BEST meatloaf ever when I tried this recipe. I actually had a family pack of ground turkey that I used (3 lbs)so I just doubled the ingredients listed since the recipe was intended for 1 1/2 lbs. I also took the advice of the other reviewers and sauteed my onions with garlic and butter before adding it to the ground turkey. Also, using Italian bread crumbs and adding the Worcestershire sauce to the mixture was perfect! My family is still talking about how delicious it was. Oh and I let it cook for 1 hour and 25 minutes like another reviewer suggested! This recipe is a WINNER! Sncgrant in NY

city:
None
region:
None
country:
None
text:
Great tasting meatloaf! There are a few things I kind of tweaked in this recipe though, (1) use seasoned breadcrumbs for more flavor, (2) after 1 hr is up remove excess liquid in loaf pan and use meat thermometer to check temp (160 for medium). If the  temp is too low place back in the oven and change temp to 375. Take out after 30 mins or once internal temp reaches 160. You shouldn't see a mushy loaf by then. Good luck fellow cooks!!

text:
I love this recipe. Here are my additions and variation changes:
I chopped red, yellow, orange, green peppers and added to ground turkey mixture along with 2T. bbq sauce, 1T. Worchestershire sauce. Used garlic & herb seasoning instead of salt & pepper. Let sit in refridgerator overnight. 
Used 1 small can tomatoe sauce with 1T. Worchestershire, 1T. bbq sauce, 3T. brown sugar. Add onion and garlic powder. Pour over meatloaf in pan. Sprinkle with parsley flakes, cover and bake as directed in recipe.  YUMMY TO MY TUMMY MOMMY is all I heard!

userID:

Display Name:
Amanda Luckey

photo:
https://images.media-allrecipes.com/userphotos/50x50/7676873.jpg
city:
None
region:
None
country:
None
text:
This has been my go-to recipe for over three years. No changes are necessary for a delicious meatloaf, but I usually replace the fresh onion with onion powder out of convenience. This freezes well both before and after baking.  Prepare the meatloaf in a foil-lined loaf pan, freeze thoroughly (at least overnight), then pop the whole thing, foil and all, out of the loaf pan and wrap tightly for the freezer. Before thawing, completely remove the foil and thaw in the same loaf pan overnight. I prefer to freeze before baking, but either way works.
Review:

5

text:
This recipe was indeed easy and came out very good. They didn't say to cover the pan when you put it in the oven but I did for the first 30 min and it came out very moist. I also seasoned the meat with some garlic and onion powder and a little seasoning salt(we like more flavor). I also minced the onions instead of chopping them so they integrated into the mixture better. All in all a great easy dinner stand by. I will use this recipe again.

text:
Very easy to make, and delicious.
I used 2 lbs meat and skim milk. Next time I'm going to add a bit of garlic salt because it was a little mild.
I cooked it longer than 1 hour. I used a meat thermometer, and took it out of the oven at 170º, then let it rest for 10 minutes before serving.
I will totally make this meatloaf again. I joined allrecipes just so that I could save this recipe and review it.

text:
This is the first time I made meatloaf. It was quite enjoyable however I was concerned that it would be too much meat so I sauteed onions, garlic, chopped zucchini and red pepper and added it to the meat mixture. We made our own sauce since the one provided didn't appeal to me.I added the sauce after a half hour and let the meat cook for about 1and a half hours. It was very moist and this allowed the sauce to really marinate the meat. Will definitely do this again and possibly with more veggies the next time since I know that the meat will not crumble.

text:
Ok, so I just took my meatloaf out of the oven and I have to say I am pleasantly surprised...especially with adding milk. I have made some modifications and want to share them with you. First, I had about 2 lbs of meat, so I seasoned that with pepper (no salt), garlic powder and adobo (to my family's taste). In addition to the onion, I chopped up a piece of green pepper, and instead of 1 cup of milk, I used 3/4 cups from what another cook mentioned and a few dashes of Worcestershire sauce in the meat (that makes a difference). Although the taste is great and very very very moist, it still came out a little mushy. I'll be sure to use only 1/2 cup of milk. My family has not tried this yet, but I'm sure they will love this. I rated this 5 because I know the next time I make this it will be perfect. SO EXCITED!!! Thanks for the recipe and happy cooking.

text:
Was so looking forward to a good meatloaf last night, but was sadly disappointed.  Followed this recipe exactly, even adding the sauteed onions and Worcestershire sauce as reviewers have suggested.  The meatloaf was soggy, and all I could taste was the breading filler, and barely the meat.  Also, I ended up baking the meatloaf for 1 1/2 hours,  just to get the internal temperature to 175 degrees.  My husband was kind enough to say it tasted good because he was starving.  If I made this recipe again, I would cut the amount of bread crumbs and milk.  The ketchup, mustard, brown sugar topping was delicious, though.  Would use that again.

text:
Delicious, truly easy meatloaf. I'm not sure why, but it almost had a buttery taste to it. Could probably use a little less breadcrumbs, because it was awfully moist.  But still yummy.  

Like a lot of the reviews, I added 1 TB of Worcestershire; I also sauteed both garlic & onion before adding to the meat.  I used a Meatloaf mix (ground beef, pork & veal) & I added some parsley & oregano.   For the sauce, I used my other meatloaf recipe sauce - 1/3 cup ketchup, 2 TB Balsamic Vinegar & a sprinkle of Red Pepper Flakes (mixed & poured over before cooking).  

My husband & kids loved this meatloaf & it's on our "Keeper" list.

text:
I'm far from being a pro in the kitchen, but this recipe gave me some hope.  I took several of the suggestions made in previous reviews like adding worcestershire sauce to the ketchup/mustard mix and sauteed the onions in butter and garlic prior to mixing with the ground beef.  I also added 1 tablespoon Chalupa hot sauce to the ketchup mix since I like a little zip in pretty much everything I eat and it turned out great!  The leftovers were even tastier.

region:

country:
None
text:
for people who cannot cannot have preservatives, wheat, or dairy (like my sister) : I used rice crumbs instead of bread crumbs, and rice milk instead of milk, organic soy sauce instead of ketchup and maple syrup instead of brown sugar. (I did use a strong german mustard even though it had sulphites. Maybe instead mustard powder could be used?) It came out well, but I think I didnt need quite so much rice crumb or milk. And next time I would make more sauce and mix some right in the meat, and put more on top, as it was a tiny too bland and ricey tasting. But that was just my taste, my parents loved it how it was.

This is a good basic meatloaf recipe.  I used Italian seasoned bread crumbs and added a small can of sliced mushroom pieces, and it turned out very moist and perfectly cooked.  Not much 'wow' factor to this dish, but it was easy to prepare and the leftovers make great sandwiches!

Lisa Joel

photo:
https://images.media-allrecipes.com/userphotos/50x50/1657669.jpg
city:
None
region:
None
country:
None
text:
This was a perfect, moist meatloaf. We had it last night and I can't wait for lunch!! Of course I read reviews and tweaked it. As suggested I used lean ground beef, sauteed the onion with 2 t garlic and 2 T finely chopped celery. I also used seasoned breadcrumbs, added T Worcestershire sauce. I used 3/4 cup skim milk and 3/4 cup crumbs. Then I formed it in a loaf pan and knocked it out on a cookie sheet (let the grease out!) lined with parchment paper (a huge time saver for cleanup) For the sauce I only used 1 T yellow mustard, 1 T dark brown sugar (packed) and a heaping 1/3 cup ketchup. Served it with garlic mashed potatoes and a yellow squash and tomato saute.  It was fantastic!

text:
Great easy meatloaf! The whole family loved it. I did make several changes based on other comments: couple splashes of worcestershire sauce, 1/4 cup of water (makes it extra tender) , 1 tb parsley flakes, basil, oregano, sprinkle of onion and garlic powder. Sauteed onions in garlic and butter.  DOUBLE or TRIPLE the sauce. Reserve some sauce for later. I used dijon mustard instead and decreased brown sugar to 1 TB.

text:
Wow! This was a great starter recipe! I did change some things: I cut up pieces of bacon and also put more on top of the loaf (amazing!), added parsley, cheddar and pepper jack cheese (in it and on top- I am a cheese lover) and used just ketchup since the brown sugar/mustard mix didn't sound very good to me. Oh, and I also used italian style bread crumbs. Luckily, I didn't add worcestershire sauce like many other people suggested because it would have made it way too juicy. I could eat this everyday! So juicy and flavorful! Thanks for sharing!

userID:
4147180
Display Name:
sarahhhha
isPro:
False
followersCount:
0

1

photo:
https://images.media-allrecipes.com/userphotos/50x50/5674138.jpg
city:
None
region:
None
country:
None
text:
I made this meatloaf tonight and it was really, really good! Perfect traditional recipe - nothing fancy - and very quick and easy. I only gave it 4 stars since I did change the recipe a little. I had no problems with it tasting too bland or being too mushy as others had commented. I used 1/2 cup of milk instead of a full cup, added 1/4 teaspoon of garlic powder, 1 tablespoon Worcestershire sauce, used one packet of Lipton beefy onion soup mix in place of an onion (I did not add any extra salt), and instead of breadcrumbs I used 1/2 cup of crushed saltines & 1/2 cup of crushed French's fried onions. I cooked them in a greased muffin tin so that they would cook even faster (about 35-40 min) and they came out great with a great texture. A lot of reviewers said the glaze was too sweet, so I opted for Alton brown's glaze instead: 1/2 cup of ketchup, 1 teaspoon cumin, dash of worcestershire sauce, dash of hot pepper sauce, and a tablespoon of honey. Put the glaze on the meatloaf 10 minutes after it's been cooking. Very good - tangy and a little sweet, but not overpowering.  I will definitely be using this recipe again when I want some quick, home-style meatloaf!
Review:
Rating:
5

Display Name:
LEYLEE24

photo:
https://images.media-allrecipes.com/userphotos/50x50/5674163.jpg
city:
None
region:
None
country:
None
text:
This turned out very nicely for me. I liked the glaze very much, it was sweet and tangy. The meatloaf was just the right consistency. The better you mix everything together, the better the consistency of the meatloaf, in my experience. I used dry bread crumbs from the store, but didn't have enough, so I toasted a piece of white bread and crumbled that in as well. My boyfriend doesn't like the chunks of onion in his meatloaf, so I put the onion through a mini food processor to mince it finely. I'm not sure if I put enough salt in (I eyeballed it) but otherwise it was tasty. I would recommend using seasoned bread crumbs, as I believe another reviewer suggested, to add a little more flavor. I poured out the excess fat as it was cooking, as the ground beef I used was high in fat, and I think this prevented it from getting too soggy. This is a good basic meatloaf recipe, and one that I will use again. My boyfriend loved it.

city:

text:
great recipe, I also added some bbq and steak sauce.  The steak sauce broke up the meat a little and added a nice flavor to it.  Added extra brown sugar and ketchup, and a bit less mustard, my family was very impressed.  Its nice to go back to the comfort foods that you can curl up to with a side of mashed potatoes.  Recipe makes great doubled and then you have left overs for the rest of the week.  My family agreed it tasted better the next day when it had the night to marinate.  Regardless, this is a nice easy meatloaf.  Also, I used less onion (purple) because we have picky eaters.  Also, it makes a difference when you take an older loaf of bread and cut it up and stick it in the oven to make your own bread crumbs.  Cooked it an additional 30 minutes (granted it was doubled) and covered it with foil and took off the foil the last 25 minutes.  Thanks for the recipe.
