photo:
https://images.media-allrecipes.com/userphotos/50x50/237126.jpg
city:
None
region:
None
country:
None
text:
This was great!  I, along with majority of the reviewers, tweaked the recipe a tad.  I sauteed an onion and a diced green pepper.  I also threw in Italian seasoning and 1-2 tablespoons of soy sauce to the mix.  Also, taking the advice of other reviewers, I decided to use a different recipe for the glaze (one that was less sweet and more tangy).  Try this... 1 cup V8, 4 tablespoons brown sugar, and 2 tablespoon soy sauce or Worcestershire sauce.  Gave it a nice tangy flavor that wasn't overpoweringly sweet.  Next time, I will probably reduce the amount of milk used.  I served it with rosemary potatoes.  Thanks for a great recipe!

city:

region:
None
country:
None
text:
This is a great recipe, but in order for it to taste good YOU SHOULDN'T FOLLOW THE DIRECTIONS EXACTLY. It needs some tweaking. The first time i made it, it was pretty disgusting how much liquid was leaking out of it. I like juicy meatloaf but it shouldn't be soupy! That was just way to much milk in addition to the worchester sauce. But since I added more seasons, garlic, onions, worchester sauce and it had good flavor so I tried it again. The 2nd time used a little less than 1/2 of the amount milk it calls for. I sauteed the onions with garlic & butter--as reviews suggested, more ketchup and less mustard. It turned out much much better.

I followed the recipe except I used a packet onion soup mix (which gave the meatloaf better flavor, I think. I substituted Boca meatless burger for ground beef. I also added some garlic salt, soy sauce, oregano and other spices to the bread cube/meat mixture. The mustard flavor was overpowering at first, but if you eat it for leftovers for a couple days, the flavors will blend and mellow out. Pretty good with ketchup.

text:
yummy and easy! I just finished eating this! oh my goodness! it was good! This was the first time I ever made meatloaf. I cooked the onion in a pan with butter and a clove of garlic until nice and golden. I made double the sauce for the meat loaf and added a teaspoon and a half of worcestershire sauce to the meat. I also used Italian seasoned bread crumbs. I just placed  the meat mixture in the loaf pan and didn't press it too much so it came out loose, but good. Next time I will shape the loaf with my hands and press it together so it will come out whole when i cut it.   GOOD RECIPE! i will make this again!

text:
I used this recipe for my first meatloaf and it came out quite good. The topping is what caught my eye. It was quite good and fast, but as I have cooked more and more, I do the meat differently now (add lipton onion soup mix, worcestershire sauce, green and/or red peppers, seasonings of choice) but I still come back for this topping. I double or triple the topping, reserving some to use in the last few minutes on broil to get it to "stick" to the loaf.

text:
My family loved this meatloaf.  Very easy to make.  I used 2 lbs hamburger and two eggs and a little extra bread crumbs. I did not use the peppers, but I did cook my onion (I also used garlic) in a pan with 2 tbsp of butter. I used a 9 x 13 pan and made two loaves. I did not make the sauce for on top because I was making gravy and mashed potatoes.  I am not a fan of meatloaf and thought it was ok.  I thought it was very good the next day cold on a sandwich.  Family gave thumbs up.  I will be making again.

text:
OMG! (yeah, it is one of those moments)This is the best meatloaf I have ever had. My husband said, this recipe is a definite keeper. So moist, smooth, melts in your mouth. My adjustments: about 2-2.5 lb of lean beef; onion and half a shredded carrot sauteed in butter; one sleeve (makes a cup and 1/4) of crushed regular saltine crackers; 1 3/4 cups of milk; 2 eggs and some seasonong for beef, or meatloaf. I had to divide the mixture in 2 parts, or it wouldn't fit into 9x5 baking pan. Baked for an hour. Voila!!! Delish!!!

https://images.media-allrecipes.com/userphotos/50x50/5614255.jpg
city:
None
region:
None
country:
None
text:
Excellent recipe!  I would definitely make this again.  I did do a few different things than the recipe call for... I added baby portabello mushrooms, VERY finely chopped because I have to try and hide veggies to get my kids to eat them (I put them in my mini food processor).  I also used a red onion and chopped it up in my mini food processor.  I used japanese panko bread crumbs which have become the bread crumb of my choice for all my cooking.  I followed the advice of others and made additional topping (1 1/2 times) and cooked it for an hour and a half.  I think next time I will bake at 375 or 400 to decrease cooking time.  I also used parchment paper on a lipped cookie sheet and it worked perfect.  This recipe is an excellent base to adding different things to your meatloaf.  It was so good that my 1 1/2 year old ate enough for 2 adults (and he doesn't eat many things!).

text:
I was looking for a 'new' way to make meatloaf and have found a keeper!  My stepson went back for seconds and he's a very picky eater!  I did take a couple suggestions from some others on the site.  I added garlic and sauteed with the onions in butter prior to adding to mixture.  Also, added about 1/4 cup of parseman cheese and increase the eggs to 2.  After letting the meatloaf sit for about 10 minutes, I began to cut into slices and remembered that I didn't add the milk.  Actually did not need the milk.  Very moist and delicious!!!  Definetely a keeper!  Thanks!!

text:
As I was preparing the ingredients for this meatloaf recipe, I realized that the milk I had had gone bad. I had already mixed most of the ingredients so it was too late to wait. I had a little bit of heavy cream in the fridge and ended up using that. I used 1/4 cup of heavy cream and 1/4 cup of white cooking wine! I also added some thin sliced/ chopped green pepper- I would say about a 1/4 cup. I used shallots instead on onions just because I like them better. This came out delicious. My boyfriend moaned mmmmmmm all through the meal! Like lasagna, I think it's hard to ruin meatloaf!

city:

region:
None
country:
None
text:
This was my second attempt at meatloaf and it turned out excellent! I did make several changes - I added about a tablespoon of minced garlic, a handful of parmesan cheese, and some worstershire sauce. When I make it again I'm going to add even more garlic (the onion flavor was stronger than the garlic and my personal preference is to have a stronger garlic flavor). 

The glaze for the top didn't sound very appealing to me since I'm not a big fan of sweet foods. I made my own sauce with a can of condensed tomato soup, about a half a cup of sour cream, and some worstershire sauce. It was delicious!

I rated it 4 stars because the flavor would have been a little bland without the extra additions and it took much longer to cook than stated. Plan on at least an extra half hour in the oven.

text:
I make my meatloaf this way all the time and there is never any left overs. The only thing I do differently is just a bit moire ketchup and mustard and brown sugar (all to taste). You can even do individual meeatloaves on top of the stove the same way. I add a little water to the sause when I make them on top of the stove. You can even top them with cheese or any of your faEvorite toppings. My family just loves meatloaf made this way.

text:
Great starter recipe. It was delicious. My family really enjoyed it. I doubled the recipe, split it into two loaf pans and topped one loaf with sliced bacon and the other with the glaze. Didn't have bread crumbs so I used crushed Ritz cracker which added a nice buttery touch to it. For the glaze, I used Dijon mustard and it came out great. We like garlic in our house so I put four cloves finely minced. Served with roasted veggies and smashed potatoes. Will definitely be making again.

country:

text:
My husband loves meatloaf; I don't care for it in any, way, or form but I like to try recipes for him.  I decreased the breadcrumbs as suggested by other reviewers and feel I could have decreased a little more.  Used 85%lean.  I prepared this the night before and let it set in the fridge.  I did love the sauce.  I added some to the meatloaf mixture and on top reserving 1 heaping servingspoonful.  10 min. before finished, I added the remaining sauce.  The sauce was not too sweet, not too tart; a good balance.  I also liked the fact that it made plenty for me to put in the loaf plus on top.  Even after sitting in the fridge overnight, although good, the loaf itself needs a little something more but this serves as a good base.  I would make again.

text:
This was the best meatloaf I've ever had. I found it moist and sweet, but not too sweet. I had run out of milk so used some BBQ sauce and water instead. This was the first time I had made meatloaf so I think next time I would not add the water just the BBQ sauce. My husband found it a little sweet but still enjoyed it so i might reduce the sugar for him next time.
